Hello JUnit community,

1)
Do I break the basic JUnit rule of class isolati=
on if I do NOT isolate
a class from its collaborators that have already bee=
n tested?

So do I still need mock/stub/fake objects for tested dependant c=
lasses
in any case?

2)
Is there any strategy/method in what order you can =
test classes for an
existing project?

Actually I explored the class depend=
encies of my project and I started
with the "leaf-classes" (meaning those t=
hat have no
dependencies/collaborators at all...). Then I took those classe=
s that
have no collaborators at all or only collaborators that were tested =
in
one of our previous test runs and so on...

Many thanks,
 Csaba
